website_summaries.verdict: Hits all the right notes in a rashguard, from comfort and durability to quality and quick drying.
pros: Available in a variety of colors and styles
Rugged and durable, with minimal seams
cons: The white option is basically see-through when wet
Some buyers say the item received has a different logo than the picture

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Runs one size small imo
customer_reviews.text: The XL fit my son who normally wears a large. My hubby who wears an XL couldn’t get in it and he’s skinny. My son is 145lb at 6’2” so pretty skinny. It’s not super tight but not loose either. Just right. Material is nice and color is amazing. He said it was comfy all day snorkeling and I could see him perfectly! Love it. Runs size small IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Trish

customer_reviews.title: it works wonderfully. I went to Phoenix for vacation and spent ...
customer_reviews.text: This "wet-suit" is actually a rash-guard. However, it works wonderfully. I went to Phoenix for vacation and spent two day full days swimming and relaxing around the pool. I stayed warm in the pool and cool when walking around. I didn't use any sunscreen, only the rash-guard and I didn't even come close to burning. It was as if i had been inside all day. I have spent six summers as a lifeguard and no sunscreen or shirt has ever afforded the same protect as this rash-guard did.
customer_reviews.author: Mateo

customer_reviews.title: Be Vareful Sizing Up for Lap Swimming
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice shirt. Everything I read said to order one or 2 sizes large because these shirts are so snug. That's what I did and it's too big. But I'm wearing it for lap swimming in a Masters class. It's too loose for that. If you are doing this type of swimming you want the shirt tight. I'd order your normal size or maybe one size up. For beach wear or boating, larger sizes would be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Pkg Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, order 1-2 sizes larger.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the majority of the reviews and ordered two sizes larger than I normally wear in t-shirts. I'm 6' 1" and 180 lbs, and normally wear a medium or sometimes a large shirt size. I found the XL size in this prduct fits well, like an U.A.-type athletic compression top, which is what I want in this type of rash guard (skin tight but not constricting). If you are looking for a slightly looser-fitting swim top for men, you may want to consider the O'Neill UV Sun Protection Men's Basic Skins T-Shirt Rashguard, I found the Large in that product fits me well, it is stretchy but not as tight and cut more like a tradional t-shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got the XXL and it is a good fit. The length is good too
customer_reviews.text: To help others with the sizing. I am 6'4", 230 lbs, 44 inch chest (measured around chest under armpits). I got the XXL and it is a good fit. The length is good too, with the hem of the shirt ending down around just below my hips. The sleeve length was a tad too long, maybe an 1.5 inches too long for me, but that is not a big deal to me (typically get shirts with 15-16" arms). Snug everywhere else. I got it so that my scuba gear won't rub on me too much, not for wearing around in public.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Good fit. Great for water sports
customer_reviews.text: I am 6ft, 200lbs. I bought a large O'Neill basic skins for ocean water sports. The skins fit snug and do not slip while surfing, boogie boarding or kayaking. Snug and flexible. Comfortable on the water and protects against sunburn. Shirt length is perfect. Length extends well below the waist and sleeves just beyond the wrist without riding up during activity. The snugness,like a wet-suit, may require someone to help pull the shirt in the back when first putting it on. Good for warm weather. The shirt breathes, unlike a wet-suit, so no overheating when not in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Hanahoku

customer_reviews.title: Misled by other reviews
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made rash guard. I disagree with the other reviews about it being way to small. What some people need to understand is that this is a rash guard and is suppose to be somewhat tight. I usually wear a l-xl, I ordered a 2x large because of reviews. I sent it back and order a xl and it fit amazing. I am 6 foot 210 pounds more of a muscular build but not ripped. I would recommend one size bigger max or regular shirt size. If you want it to fit like a shirt that's not what it is meant for.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Errington

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is accurate in my experience
customer_reviews.text: I really don't understand why so many reviews say to buy a size (or 2) up. I'm 6', 200 lbs and fit a standard large t-shirt very comfortably. I bought an XL and found it to be standard XL in torso length and sleeve length. It's a rash guard, so it sits tight to the body, but I believe the sizing to be accurate in my case. As for quality, the material is relatively soft, but the stitching on the inside seams are a little scratchy. They could be better for sure. Overall, I feel like it is a decent product for the price
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jorgy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but runs small
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear large on all my shirts, after reading many comments I decided to order X-LG and for me it's a tight fit but not to return it. I believe after a few swims at sea it will lose a little bit and also in my case I prefer on this kind of shirts not to be loose. That aside, great quality! Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: ISAAC GUAJARDO

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor laps without the sunburn
customer_reviews.text: Seems to provide great sun protection, I wear it swimming laps in an outdoor pool in North Carolina. I find the sleeves quite long but otherwise it is tight-fitting, which is what I was looking for. Other shirts that I've had get loose around the arms and drag my arms while swimming, this one doesn't do that nearly as much as my other shirts.
customer_reviews.author: kev994

customer_reviews.title: 170 lbs and this large fits perfect. It is snug
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how these will do once I get out on the water, but for those looking for sizing, I am 5'10, 170 lbs and this large fits perfect. It is snug, but supposed to be. Any drawback would be in the arm length...a bit long, but not by much, so very acceptable and very comfortable. Also seems very well made. I bought these to wear when fishing off my jetski, so will update later on it's actual use.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Fits great! But order a size or two up.
customer_reviews.text: I just received the shirt. Fits well but you must get a size or two over your normal size or it will show every roll you have. (I'm talking to you big guys) I am 5'11" 215. I am built like a running back with wide shoulder and thinner waist. I normal wear a XL and if a shirt runs small I go 2XL. This shirt everyone is saying it very tight, I went with a 3XL. It fits awesome! It is tight but has plenty of breathing room since I don't like my shirts to tight. Don't forget it will probably shrink a little when you wash and dry it too.
customer_reviews.author: Bathe And Beauty

customer_reviews.title: Best long sleeve ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I swim three times a week and have tried other long sleeves. This one is my favorite. It fits snug and the sleeves are the right length. All the other the sleeves are way too long. The material is heavier than I expected but I like the weight. Only my Speedo long sleeve is comparable and it cost twice as much. Excellent quality material, well made, and fits perfectly. I will be trying more O' Neal products. Really a nice surprise!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Great shirt-for women too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself, (I am a women, 5' 6") and like the way the mens fit better than the womens shirts. It is a bit long in the torso but I imagine it is due to it being a Mens 2XL. I really like the feel of it and wear it to avoid sunburn when fishing, swimming and paddleboarding. It also has a nice collar although you cannot see that in the photo
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Great just order a size or two up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend and after reading the reviews, ordered two sizes up. Thank goodness I did because the 3X fit perfectly! It's a great top and handy for those of us who burn easily, but make sure to get a couple sizes up if you don't want a snug fit. For reference my boyfriend is 6'3 and 240 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good...but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great looking rash guard. I would say get 2 sizes larger than you're used to. I use L, in t-shirts and shirts with brands like GAP or Banana Republic, and the XXL fit snug, while the XXXL is a bit loose. I have had Billabong and Quicksilver rash guards, and I found that those are more comfortable than the O'neil. I guess it's the seams placement. I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love this Thing
customer_reviews.text: This rash guard always comes with me when I travel. This thing is perfect for putting under your wetsuit for added warmth, putting on in warm water for sun protection, or just keeping you warm in warm-mild water. I love it and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Siu

customer_reviews.title: Good Shirt, If Used Moderately
customer_reviews.text: This is a good shirt for short periods of time in the water. I was in the water for about 8 hours, and because of the mock-neck-like neckband, it gave me a deep gash on the back of my neck were the neckband had rubbed up against. My neck still has a scar from it. That being said, everything else about this shirt is great. Gives good protection against jellyfish and anything else floating in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant F.

customer_reviews.title: Great pool/beach and snorkeling skins
customer_reviews.text: Two things you should know; as the name implies "skins" which is not a very good insulator but meant more for sun block and if you don't want it too tight buy it a size or two larger. I normally use a large and I went with 2XL and it fits good. I'm a little on the husky side. If you wear large and thin built go with XL. The size chart is why I rated 4 stars, not accurate. As for the wet suit itself I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: inspector gadget 007

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shirt if you get the right size
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shirt if you get the right size. They're supposed to be tight, but it's a bit too tight for me - especially around the neck (not a good place to be tight) if I wear my typical size. I ordered 1 size bigger (got a lg) and fits great. I'm 6' 150 lbs with bmi right in the middle of ideal if that helps with sizing perspective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I do like them. They prevent chaffing on my upper arms
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these, one this color and an all blue one. When you compare the labels on the inside, they are identical but this one is larger and looser on my body. I have no idea why. So my answer is that size seems to vary between items a bit. I do like them. They prevent chaffing on my upper arms. They seem well made and have been worn a lot this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Miller

customer_reviews.title: Buy one size larger!
customer_reviews.text: It "fit as expected" because per others' reviews I ordered a size up, XXL vs. my usual XL. Sleeves are a little long but are tight enough to be pushed up a little and stay put, or can be tucked under. Clearly an XL would have been very tight, which may be how these are intended but is not my preference.
customer_reviews.author: bagpiper

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for casual beach wear!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband (6' 155 lbs) for an upcoming beach trip. He hasn't used it in water yet, but tried it on and it fits nicely. He usually wears a Med in shirts, but sometimes needs a Large for arm length, so I bought this in a Large. It fits snug as a rash guard is expected to, but not uncomfortably tight. Looking forward to trying it out in the water!
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp looking. I am only a little over 5'6" and thin so I ordered the small. Fit was tight but not uncomfortable. I have yet to use it a pool or lake so I cannot comment on how it will feel after wearing it for hours. Sleeves were a tad long so some wrinkles by pulling that back to my wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very good for surfing
customer_reviews.text: It's so good. Usually I use regular wetsuit for surfing but it's too hot these days. So I bought it and tried it. It stretched very well so it doesn't bother me when I paddle on board. The only flaw is some debris inside. I found several debris of thread. That's it.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Lee

customer_reviews.title: Order your t-shirt size !
customer_reviews.text: Nice rash guard, but it was too large. I took the advice of some reviewers who suggested a size up from my normal t-shirt size, but that resulted in a shirt that was still snug, but baggy under the arms and long in the sleeves and body. I reordered the medium and it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: B. MacKinnon

customer_reviews.title: Very good looking rash guard.
customer_reviews.text: This is a tighter fit which is what I expected. I usually wear a Medium in regular T shirts so I ordered a Large and so far so good. I really like the color combination and the price was significantly cheaper than the same version in store. I'll update the review if I have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aw

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten a lighter color, but otherwise nice.
customer_reviews.text: Skin tight but that was to be expected. I wore this for a day or so when rafting the Grand Canyon, but found it was too warm due to the color. My own issue, but all in the all, this is a nice piece of clothing.
customer_reviews.author: ARo

customer_reviews.title: ~6 foot tall and 180 lbs. Form fitting stuff ...
customer_reviews.text: ~6 foot tall and 180 lbs. Form fitting stuff I usually go with Large (medium most of the time for everything else). Follow the advice of others here and go two sizes up from what you normally get. I went with XL and it fits about right for what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: altdrsmoothop

customer_reviews.title: Sized "snug", very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews suggested buying big; follow those instructions unless you want it wetsuit tight. I'm a pretty big guy, 6'2" (187cm), I usually wear large or (smaller) XL t-shirts, and I got the 2X-Large size. It fits well and snugly, not restrictive or overly tight, and does not rise up. It would be appropriate under my wetsuit (tight enough) and is great by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wilsker

customer_reviews.title: Great for sun protection in the water
customer_reviews.text: I got this for sun protection while in the water over summer because I didnt want to put on sunscreen all day every day. This was what I needed. I liked the fact that it had full arm protection. I found that it dried fast and did the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Not USA sized
customer_reviews.text: They looked like good quality, long arms and broud shoulders but the stomach was like a small I ordered xl I weigh 177 lbs. not 100% sure they are name brand or copies. Returned items because of the very slim fit one worse than the other. Bummer.....
customer_reviews.author: JohnSnow

customer_reviews.title: The XXL was almost a perfect fit. I normally wear a 37 inch sleeve
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'7" 220lbs and tried both the XXL and 3XL. The XXL was almost a perfect fit. I normally wear a 37 inch sleeve, and this sleeve fit perfectly. It is a snug fit, but that is the design. The 3XL wad considerably more length to it, and was a bit loose in the arms. Both had a nice fit, but I opted to keep the XXL.
customer_reviews.author: Mike from IL

customer_reviews.title: Sweet rash guard
customer_reviews.text: It's fashionable and it fits snugly but allows for nice movement and looks cool with my swim trunks. Black goes with everything. And I retired my white patagonia rash guard bc it "showed too much" especially when it got wet. Def go with dark blue or black rash guards. "Now go slam some kooks! "
customer_reviews.author: JFH

customer_reviews.title: Nice long sleeve
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. Haven't tried it in water yet but seems kinda like a thermal would be. Update after beach trip. Doesn't really keep you all that warm but does save you from sun burn. It makes a slight difference on keeping warm I'd say.
customer_reviews.author: socal

customer_reviews.title: Great Shirt!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to the reviews, we ordered a size larger - XXL and it fits good and snug just like you want it to. This is the real deal! It's a little heavier weight fabric (not a dry fit shirt) which is perfect for extended time in the water or for early morning water skiing when it's a little chilly! The style is great and goes with any swim trunk.
customer_reviews.author: patti

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but faaaaar too small
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but faaaaar too small. I wear a large t-shirt so I got the XXL just for comfort and it is incredibly tight. I understand the purpose of these are to be worn under wetsuits so tightness is expected, however it was almost painful even trying to put it on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Oniell
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a large t shirt and due to all the reviews about how snug it was i got a 2 x and i was surprised how well it fit. It wasn't loose at all just tight enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great just runs slightly small
customer_reviews.text: My husband wears a LARGE normally but after reading reviews I ordered XL which fits perfectly/fitted. My husband is well built/fit with a small waist and the XL is fitted but just right for all the water sports he does. It is nice quality and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Cseke

customer_reviews.title: I ordered one several sizes larger because I like it loose
customer_reviews.text: Based on previous reviews, I ordered one several sizes larger because I like it loose. I don't surf, I use this to keep me warm while I swim in the winter and sometimes I use it in the summer when I don't want to put on sunscreen. I have had it for more than a year and it is holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: travelingbean

customer_reviews.title: Get it bigger than you think you need, but it is really great, so make sure to get it if you go snorkeling in warm water.
customer_reviews.text: I got this, it was two sizes too small, returned it, and got a bigger one, loved the bigger one. Used it all the time in Hawaii to use less sun screen. Really great skin protection.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: I think I grew!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my son-in-law and to go with his new Sea-Do, however, the shirt was too small and felt binding on him. Item was returned without any problem and another was ordered in the next size larger!
customer_reviews.author: Twinkle Toes

customer_reviews.title: Good skin
customer_reviews.text: Love this shirt and have worn it may times when boating, on a PWC or wakeboarding. Good fit and good quality as it hasn't fallen apart after many washes. It is meant to be a tighter fitting shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Beware, Fit is Small
customer_reviews.text: Product is excellent, I wear ata the beach instead of greasy sun lotion, makes you look buff :o), but as I said, runs small, I woulg go on size higher...
customer_reviews.author: Floridian

customer_reviews.title: Love these skins!
customer_reviews.text: Love these skins! I have two different ones in two colors. They fit perfect! I'm a 48' chest with 34 waist and not too tight with an XL
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: Works great for snorkeling or any water adventure while saving you from the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dawson

customer_reviews.title: The shirt seems like it's made with good material
customer_reviews.text: I have a 42 inch chest and bought the large. The shirt seems like it's made with good material, but it's a very tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: High quality, fits well.
customer_reviews.text: It's thin wetsuit... it should be tight. It fit as expected. I use it as a minimal insulation scuba top to work with my 5mm sleeveless farmer john wetsuit.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Even the XXL is tight and the size chart says I take an XL. At 5'9 and 190 I'm no string bean, but you'd think their largest size would accommodate. Aside from doing a Houdini straight jacket imitation getting this on, it's a good quality top.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect rash guard for my 12 yo who surfs and skimboards in RI. He wore a Medium and is 100 pounds 5-3. We got the rash guard shorts for under his suit and it was ideal for rash-prevention. Price is great for the quality product. It dries out quickly too --
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: yes, good.
customer_reviews.text: I like this very much. I wear a large shirt/coat/fleece ...everything. But here I purchased an Xlarge and that's great. 5'9" 185#
customer_reviews.author: W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Go 3 sizes up for right fit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 one for my son and on for me. I ordered 2 sizes up as per some reviews and found you should go up 3 sizes. I ware a LG shirt and purchased 2XL and can't get the wetsuit over my chest without help. Once on I look like a super hero in a skin tight suit. My son wares a youth LG so I purchased a adult Med and he can barely fit in the suit.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Givens

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Skin tight but not uncomfortable. Fits like most rash guards I've had in the past. Large was good for athletic 6' 179lbs.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: this item looked like a quality piece but like probably most wet suits ...
customer_reviews.text: this item looked like a quality piece but like probably most wet suits this one was tailored for teenagers and young adults not for slightly over sized adults. to bad. I had to return this item but I'm still looking for one that fits properly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Hubby is 5'9" and 169. He has a very stocky build with large muscles and this fit him perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Helps with less lotion better for the oceans
customer_reviews.text: It fits well and I have been taking it now on almost every dive trip.... It's good too bc less suntan lotion, which means better for the oceans and less need for sunscreen/skin protection besides the skin.... A+
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous-Individual

customer_reviews.title: Runs small but well made
customer_reviews.text: Very well made item. I wear an XL in a normal shirt. I got a 3x after reading reviews. The 3x is pretty close to what I would need. If you have any belly at all go big.
customer_reviews.author: knuep

customer_reviews.title: Nice Skins to Wear Shorediving in ABCs
customer_reviews.text: This was the only thing I wore for a week of diving in Bonaire and Curacao, it fits well provides a little thermal protection, and after 10 days of 4 dives a day it still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Lucca B.

customer_reviews.title: No more sun screen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shirt to protect myself from the sun when I was out in the water. I normally wear medium to large shirts. After reading the reviews I decided to buy an extra large shirt. It fits great. It also makes for a pleasant experience for the rest of the beach visitors. They don't have to see my pale hairy stomach! It dries quickly and breaths. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jfalcon

customer_reviews.title: watch out
customer_reviews.text: product does not provide meaningful temperature protection - suitable only for warm water swimming
customer_reviews.author: rr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good but too small. I purchase XL but is similar as S.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: this rashguard gives me neck rash!!!! What the hell man. I'm better off commando/ rip curl spring suit
customer_reviews.author: CXK

customer_reviews.title: best choice !
customer_reviews.text: try them once... You'll love the feeling. Not too hot, not too cold, just perfect for paddling.
customer_reviews.author: Catalin

customer_reviews.title: and the fit is nice and snug
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6", 165lbs, I ordered one size up, Large, and the fit is nice and snug, not too tight. You should Order at least one size up if you don't want to be strangled
customer_reviews.author: Gilberto Silva B.

customer_reviews.title: Great rash shirt for an awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: This is slightly thicker than our usual rash shirt so it offers a little more warmth then you would expect from a rash shirt. Great for wakeboarding when your moving fast and have to deal with the temp drop due to evaporation.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasio Sarigiannis

customer_reviews.title: Glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I wear a large normally and heeded the advice of reviewers to go a size larger. Glad I did. It fit well, didn't ride up and wasn't too tight.
customer_reviews.author: ja

customer_reviews.title: Great Product/Price
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this shirt. It says it runs small, but I still got him his normal size. It fits a little snug, but he likes it and says it is supposed to fit that way and he enjoys wearing it when he kiteboards.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the first one I got my shirt size is large but was very small so I ordered 2X large so be careful when you order
customer_reviews.author: John M Kavanagh

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband as a replacement rash guard for kiteboarding. Gotta say it certainly gives the man an athletic "cut." Works great so far. Will update on longevity if we have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: MsTHS

customer_reviews.title: Purchased size XXL for waist size 36"-38" and fits comfortably. Great cover up and gray line would make ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased size XXL for waist size 36"-38" and fits comfortably. Great cover up and gray line would make look slimmer LOL
customer_reviews.author: BlessedDay

customer_reviews.title: O'Neil is the real deal!
customer_reviews.text: I use O'Neil wetsuits and rash-guards exclusively because they fit the best, look the best, and are a great price. This one is no exception. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: RGBforlife99

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: We love it, very attractive and good quality. Fits as expected by size chart, none too big.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great rash guard and sunscreen.
customer_reviews.text: This rash guard works well for both reducing friction when atop a board and offering protection against the sun. Don't expect it to provide warmth, it actually keeps you cooler when wet.
customer_reviews.author: BDK

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: Will test it in water later on (windsurfing Bonaire) but looks great and fits great. The only comment: you have possibly to buy 1 size larger. I am 6'3'' and 220lbs , XXL fits perfectly, anything smaller would not be OK
customer_reviews.author: Andrea B

customer_reviews.title: No Burn!
customer_reviews.text: Wore this Kayaking in Hawaii and it kept me from getting cooked by the sun. Was very comfy and not constrictive. If you are looking for a nice rash guard this is your winner.
customer_reviews.author: ZiplinePete

customer_reviews.title: Great rash Gaurd
customer_reviews.text: Great rash Gaurd ! Probably could have used a size up but it fits fine in general. Perfect warmth in water and I will def order more
customer_reviews.author: Scuba Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It protects as advertised and appears to be well made. I purchase a medium and I'm 5'9" at 140 and the shirt is a very snug fit as in I need help to pull it off. I believe it should be snug, but perhaps I should have gone for a large.
customer_reviews.author: DRH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy about my purchase thank you for your good business YB
customer_reviews.author: Yves Boisvert

customer_reviews.title: too small
customer_reviews.text: way way too small, it might be a mix up,,, kids size, for sure not for a adult thank you
customer_reviews.author: HELMI M FELFEL

customer_reviews.title: good quality. Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this top, good quality. Great product. He is large take 1 or 2 sizes up to ensure fit.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: The other wetsuit/rash guard I ordered was a 3x and it fits just fine. I am sending the O'Neill back
customer_reviews.text: Way too small. The other wetsuit/rash guard I ordered was a 3x and it fits just fine. I am sending the O'Neill back.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Returning as it's too large.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews that all said order 1 or 2 sizes over normal. I ordered 1 size over normal and it's definitely too loose, so will return for the right size. Otherwise, quality and all looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Donovon J. White

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great fit
customer_reviews.text: Usually wear a medium t-shirt. I read the reviews that said to purchase a size bigger, so I ordered a large. It fits just how I had wanted it to. Great quality, great fit, great product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Hubby looks cute in his slightly too tight rash guard
customer_reviews.text: He has a little trouble getting it on, but he looks pretty good once it is on! Better, it should protect his Irish-American skin from the sun!
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine Eve

customer_reviews.title: a bigger size would have been so much better.
customer_reviews.text: My fiance bought a 3X to wear in cozumel.... it was way too tight to wear.. very uncomfortable. a bigger size would have been so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Anntoinette

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: wear XL bought 3XL and fit is good for me. 6'2" 230 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: lsnydes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this item offers great protection from the sun and keeps you cool
customer_reviews.author: Bkayzfinest

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have used extensively in Hawaii and have had no problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Fits beautifully, comfortable around neck, feels like it was custom made clean seams. Just very well made. I'm sure I'll have it for years!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby T.

customer_reviews.title: the quality and comfort you would expect from O'Neill
customer_reviews.text: Fit well and was comfortable! The quality was the same as the one purchased years ago. We expect it to last as long as the first one. Slimming too.
customer_reviews.author: Ddeaks

customer_reviews.title: Who does'nt love O'Neill
customer_reviews.text: I did buy the red and black. I think I have to return because I think I put on like 10 lbs over the summer. My fault not O'Neill's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Kaiama

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews to order this item one size larger than I usually do. It fit very nicely and does a great job of withstanding chlorine. I bought it for protection from the sun's harmful rays. I am very pleased with how the material is sturdy and does what I intended it to do. I recommend this product! I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Pfaffenberger

customer_reviews.title: runs a bit tight
customer_reviews.text: I am a large, and bought the XL based on previous reviews and was a bit tight
customer_reviews.author: ALFRED J EMMI

customer_reviews.title: really nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who is 40+. He's usually a large but has a loveable belly. We ordered extra large and it fits nicely. Although it is snug on the belly it is surprisingly slimming with the color combination. I'm sure he'll get a lot of use out of it on our upcoming trip to Mexico. As with other comments I would go up a size.
customer_reviews.author: quiteunderstanding

customer_reviews.title: Real deal
customer_reviews.text: Colors may look a bit different from the ones on the picture, but quality and fit is as expected. I recommend to buy one size bigger because it is tight fit. It looks original and the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked as hoped - comfortable fit for 6'1" 160 pound teenager - used for ...
customer_reviews.text: worked as hoped - comfortable fit for 6'1" 160 pound teenager - used for surfing and snorkeling - and protection from extreme sun in Costa Rica - not sure what SPF rating was, but seemed to work OK for sunshield.
customer_reviews.author: Todd G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for my boyfriend and totally love it!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This rash guard fits well and has held up to several dives, snorkel trips and washing cycles. Very comfortable. Not sloppy or too tight
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but order larger
customer_reviews.text: I ordered based on the guidelines they provided. However way too small. Other brands fit at this size, and this one was far from it. Be sure to order one up of whatever you normally do.
customer_reviews.author: 1998RC

customer_reviews.title: fit good for
customer_reviews.text: minor thing but the white seams are more grey. 6' 190 lbs, got the 2 XL, fit good for me
customer_reviews.author: zzzzzzzzzzzx

product_meta.title: O'Neill Men's Basic Skins UPF 50+ Long Sleeve Rash Guard
product_meta.description: O'Neill Basic Skins are simple, durable base layer shirts designed to protect you from the elements in and out of the water. A sleek fit and clean graphics highlight the top, which is made of five-ounce polyester and four-way stretch spandex. Flatloc stitching is comfortable and durable, and Basic Skins both rash protection and 50+ UV protection.
feature_bullets: [U.P.F. 50+ Max UV Protection Factor by O'Neill] creates tight Performance Fit that hugs your body like a second skin.
[Skin Cancer Foundation Recommended] Polyester/Spandex blend for effective UV protection with minimal heat absorption.
[Quick Dry 4-way Stretch Moves with You] for wearing alone or under a wetsuit for rash protection with minimal seam placement.
[Strategic Seamless Paddle Zones Stop Chafing] Supports movement throughout this O'Neill Basic Skins 50+ long sleeved rash guard with value-driven choices.
[O'Neill Wetsuits since 1952 Creating Industry Leading Functional Gear] Cleanly Designed Graphics for rash prevention during outdoor sports and activities.
